newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil March unemployment up at 5.97 pct - IBGE.
newsitem.headline: Brazil March unemployment up at 5.97 pct - IBGE.

text.p: Brazil's March unemployment rate increased to 5.97 percent from 5.55 percent in February, the National Statistics Institute (IBGE) said.
However, the unemployment rate fell in comparison with March 1996 when it stood at 6.38 percent, the IBGE said.
The number of people working rose 0.6 percent from February to March while the number of people out of work increased 8.4 percent in the six main urban centers surveyed, the IBGE said.
The unemployment rate rose in all six urban areas except in Recife, where unemployment declined, the IBGE said.

Unemployment rose mainly in the services sector, reaching 4.76 percent in March in comparison with February's 4.31 percent, while the construction sector was the only one to see a fall in unemployment.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
